alert.note: Alert for Pembina (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 8:41PM CDT until May 06 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. .Flooding along the Pembina River will continue. All rises and the sustained major flooding are due to snow melt in Canada entering the Pembina River. No major precipitation events are expected for the next seven days. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, MAY 06... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pembina River at Neche. * WHEN...Until Saturday, May 06. * IMPACTS...At 20.5 feet, MAJOR FLOOD. Railroad upstream of gage is overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Friday was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
